attributes.action: Call for a no vote of no confidence as David Cameron resigns as PM.
attributes.additional_details: The Fixed-term Parliament Act 2011 states that a general election can only be held every five years unless the House of Commons resolves that there is a vote of no confidence in HM government or if two-thirds of the seats in the House of Commons call for a general election. If you sign this petition, please contact your local MP, inform them that you have no confidence in HM government and request that they call for a vote of no confidence and a general election.
attributes.background: As David Cameron resigns from the position of PM; I feel that there should be a call of a vote of no confidence in HM government so that there will be a general election. This is to prevent the next PM being one that is not democratically elected.
